title: School Holiday Today, August 20 Live Updates: Maharashtra (Mumbai), Karnataka, Kerala, Jammu & Kashmir And Other States School Closed Due To Heavy Rain - thedailyjagran.com
article_text:
By Sarju Saran Tiwari
Wed, 20 Aug 2025 10:17 AM (IST)

School Holiday Today Live Updates: The monsoon season often brings challenges and heavy rainfall is expected in many states in August 2025. Ensuring the safety of students is a major concern for the authorities, necessitating the closure of schools to prevent incidents arising from flooding, waterlogging or traffic disruptions.

School Holiday Due to Rain on 20 August 2025 is expected in various districts of Maharashtra, Karnataka, Jammu & Kashmir, Kerala other states. Students can check the updates here for each of the states here to understand the possibility of getting a school holiday on August 20, 2025. 

Local district collectors and education departments are working closely with the India Meteorological Department (IMD) to monitor weather conditions.

Decisions to close schools are often taken at short notice, sometimes only a day in advance, to adapt to the rapidly changing weather. Students and their parents are advised to check the official announcements of their respective state governments, district administrations and schools for the most accurate information.

This live blog presents a comprehensive overview of the school holiday status in states across the country, helping parents and students stay informed about the latest developments in time.

title: IMD Issues Red Alert for Gujarat, Goa and Coastal Maharashtra; Heavy Rains Forecast Across Multiple States - Newsonair
article_text:
The Indian Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a red alert for extremely heavy rainfall over Gujarat, Goa and the coastal areas of Maharashtra for today. The IMD also predicted heavy rainfall over Jammu and Kashmir, Uttarakhand, Himachal Pradesh and eastern Rajasthan for the next two to three days.

Similar conditions are expected over Madhya Pradesh, Sikkim, Chhattisgarh and Sub-Himalayan West Bengal during the next seven days. In the southern part of the nation, these conditions will also prevail over the coastal areas of Karnataka and Telangana today. The weather agency has also forecast very light to light rain with thundershowers till tomorrow over Delhi NCR.

title: सावधान! खतरा अभी टला नहीं, जम्मू-कश्मीर में अगले दो दिनों में फिर बदलेगा मौसम; लोगों के लिए अलर्ट जारी - Jammu and Kashmir Weather Alert Heavy Rainfall Warning Issued for 23 August to 25 august alert issued - Jagran
article_text:
जागरण संवाददाता, जम्मू। मौसम विभाग की माने तो खतरा अभी टला नहीं है। लोगों को सतर्क रहने की जरूरत है। हालांकि मंगलवार को जम्मू-कश्मीर के अधिकांश हिस्सों में मौसम में सुधार देखने को मिला, लेकिन मौसम विज्ञान केंद्र श्रीनगर ने प्रदेश में 23 से 25 अगस्त के बीच भारी वर्षा का अलर्ट जारी किया है।

विभाग ने चेतावनी दी है कि इस अवधि के बीच तेज बारिश से बादल फटने, अचानक बाढ़, भूस्खलन, मिट्टी व पत्थरों के खिसकने जैसी घटनाएं हो सकती हैं। लोगों को सलाह दी गई है कि वे नदियों, नालों, जलस्रोतों और कच्चे मकानों से दूर रहें।

मौसम विभाग के अनुसार, 20 से 22 अगस्त तक मौसम सामान्यतः गर्म व उमस भरा रहेगा। बीच-बीच में कुछ स्थानों पर हल्की वर्षा व तेज हवा चल सकती है।

22 अगस्त की देर रात जम्मू, कठुआ व सांबा जिलों में भारी वर्षा होने के आसार हैं। वहीं 26 अगस्त को आसमान पर बादला छाए रहेंगे और कुछ स्थानों पर वर्षा की संभावना है।

27 से 30 अगस्त तक मौसम गर्म व उमस भरा रहेगा। हालांकि बीच में हल्की वर्षा या तूफान की स्थिति बन सकती है। इस बीच, मंगलवार को जम्मू संभाग में कई जगह बादल छाए रहे और हल्की बारिश हुई।

title: IMD Warning 20 August: मौसम का बदलेगा मिजाज! छत्तीसगढ़ के कई जिलों में होगी भारी बारिश, IMD का ऑरेंज-येलो अलर्ट जारी - Patrika News
article_text:
CG Weather Update: बस्तर संभाग में पिछले 24 घंटे से भारी से अतिभारी बारिश होने से नदी-नाले उफान पर है। इधर राजधानी में भी दोपहर पानी गिरने से लोगों को राहत मिली है। मौसम विभाग के अनुसार 20 अगस्त से बस्तर संभाग में बारिश की गतिविधियां कम हो जाएंगी। अगले 24 घंटे में प्रदेश में कहीं-कहीं भारी बारिश हो सकती है। कहीं-कहीं आकाशीय बिजली भी गिर सकती है। पिछले 24 घंटे में सबसे ज्यादा बारिश नारायणपुर में 14 सेमी हुई।
बुधवार सुबह मौसम विभाग ने प्रदेश के विभिन्न जिलों में अगले तीन घंटे के भीतर बारिश के लिए अलर्ट जारी किया है। इनमें ऑरेंज अलर्ट वालें जिले हैं -उत्तर बस्तर कांकेर, बालोद, राजनांदगांव, रायपुर, बलौदा बाज़ार, जांजगीर-चांपा, बिलासपुर, दुर्ग, बेमेतरा, कबीरधाम, मुंगेली. इन क्षेत्रों में मेघगर्जन, बिजली गिरने और तेज हवा (30-40KMPH) के साथ मध्यम वर्षा की संभावना जताई गई है।
वहीं बीजापुर, नारायणपुर, कोंडागांव, उत्तर बस्तर कांकेर, धमतरी, बालोद, गरियाबंद, महासमुंद, रायपुर, बलौदा बाज़ार, जांजगीर-चांपा, बिलासपुर, कोरबा, गौरेला-पेंड्रा-मरवाही, दुर्ग, बेमेतरा, कबीरधाम, मुंगेली में मध्यम वर्षा की संभावना है। यहां यलो अलर्ट जारी किया गया है।
मुंबई में भारी बारिश के कारण ट्रेनों की रफ्तार थम गई है। अनेक ट्रेनें देरी से चल रही हैं तो वहीं, कुछ का मार्ग बदला गया है। रायपुर मंडल से गुजरने वाली ट्रेनें भी देरी से रवाना की जाएंगी। मुंबई से मंगलवार को भी कुछ ट्रेनें देरी से चलीं।

title: Heavy rain lashes Chandigarh traffic hit due to inundated roads - theweek.in
article_text:
Chandigarh, Aug 19 (PTI) Heavy rain lashed parts of Chandigarh on Tuesday, leading to traffic disruptions and waterlogging in many areas.
    Several roads, including those leading towards Panchkula, were inundated, leaving vehicles stranded as traffic jams were reported at some locations.
    The parking lot of the Punjab and Haryana Civil Secretariats was also flooded, while water accumulated in the Sector 11-15 underpass, prompting fire officials to drain it.
    Two of the three floodgates of the Sukhna lake here were opened to release the excess water through the Sukhna choe.
    The roads inside the PGIMER here were also waterlogged immediately after the heavy spell of showers, causing inconvenience to those visiting the institute.
    "Unprecedented rainfall has caused water to overflow. We are actively working to resolve the situation," PGIMER's official spokesperson said in a statement.
    "There was heavy rain in many parts of Chandigarh, with the northern sectors of the city the worst-hit. However, there were some parts of the city, particularly the southern sectors, which did not receive rain," an office goer returning home said.
    Following heavy rainfall in the Ghaggar river catchment, the Patiala district administration issued a safety advisory on Tuesday for villagers residing near the river.
    Residents were urged to immediately inform the Patiala District Control Room in the case of rising water levels.

title: Himachal Weather: भारी बारिश-भूस्खलन से तबाही जारी, सैकड़ों सड़कें बाधित, इन उपमंडलों में आज स्कूल बंद - Amar Ujala
article_text:
Himachal Weather: भारी बारिश-भूस्खलन से तबाही जारी, राज्य में 402 सड़कें बाधित, इन उपमंडलों में आज स्कूल बंद
न्यूज डेस्क, अमर उजाला, शिमला। Published by: Krishan Singh Updated Wed, 20 Aug 2025 10:32 AM IST
सार
7085 Followers
कुल्लू
भारी बारिश-भूस्खलन से तबाही जारी है। जगह-जगह भूस्खलन से राज्य में तीन नेशनल हाईवे सहित 402 सड़कें बंद हैँ।
कुल्लू और ऊना में बारिश से हुई तबाही। - फोटो : अमर उजाला
विस्तार
Follow Us

हिमाचल प्रदेश में भारी बारिश-भूस्खलन से तबाही जारी है। राज्य के कई क्षेत्रों में रात से मूसलाधार बारिश हो रही है। जगह-जगह भूस्खलन से राज्य में सैकड़ों सड़कें बंद हैं। भारी बारिश से कुल्लू के पीज गांव के नाले में अचानक जलस्तर बढ़ गया। इससे जिला मुख्यालय के साथ लगते शास्त्रीनगर नाले में बाढ़ आ गई। बड़ी मात्रा में मलबा और पानी संपर्क सड़क से मुख्य मार्ग पर आ गया। साथ लगती दुकानों में भी मलबा और पानी घुस गया। कई वाहन मलबे में फंस गए। नाले का जलस्तर बढ़ता देख आसपास रहने वाले लोग घरों से निकलकर सुरक्षित स्थानों पर चले गए। प्रशासन ने मनाली और बंजार उपमंडल के सभी शिक्षण संस्थानों में आज अवकाश घोषित किया है। राज्य में बुधवार सुबह 10:00 तक तीन नेशनल हाईवे सहित 402 सड़कें बंद रहीं। 550 बिजली ट्रांसफार्मर व 132 जल आपूर्ति योजनाएं भी प्रभावित हैं। मंडी व कुल्लू जिले में सबसे अधिक सड़कें ठप हैं।

title: Monsoon Disrupts Himachal Pradesh: Cloudburst in Kullu, Roads Blocked, Schools Closed, Dams Releasing Water - Newsonair
article_text:
The spell of monsoon rain is continuing intermittently in some districts of Himachal Pradesh today as well. In the Kullu district, a cloudburst occurred on the Peej hill at around 3:30 a.m. today, due to which heavy stones and debris entered the drain flowing through Shastri Nagar in the town, causing damage to about four vehicles.

However, no loss of life has been reported. Considering the weather conditions, all educational institutions in the Manali subdivision have been ordered to remain closed today. Meanwhile, due to the rising water levels in dams, water is being released regularly, and people have been advised to take precautions. From Pong Dam in Kangra district, 75,000 cusecs of water will be released today.

According to the report of the State Emergency Operation Centre, 356 roads, including one national highway, are closed for traffic due to landslides. In addition, 872 electricity transformers and 140 drinking water supply schemes have also been disrupted. The Meteorological Department has issued a yellow alert for rainfall in the state till August 25.

title: Low pressure over Bay of Bengal triggers cyclone warning in Tamil Nadu ports - deshsewak.org
article_text:
A low-pressure system has formed over the west-central and northwest Bay of Bengal, close to the northern Andhra Pradesh and southern Odisha coasts, prompting the India Meteorological Department (IMD) to issue cyclone warnings for several Tamil Nadu ports.
According to the IMD, the system is expected to move in a west-northwest direction over the next few days.
As a result, heavy rainfall is likely along the coastal regions of Andhra Pradesh and Odisha, while Tamil Nadu, particularly its northeastern districts, is expected to experience intermittent showers influenced by the weather disturbance.
In view of the situation, cyclone warning signal number 1 has been hoisted at Nagapattinam port. Similar alerts have been sounded in eight other ports -- Chennai, Cuddalore, Puducherry, Karaikal, Ennore, Pamban, Kattupalli, and Thoothukudi.
The warning indicates the possibility of squally winds and rough sea conditions, and fishermen have been strongly advised not to venture into the sea until further notice.
Weather officials have cautioned that while Tamil Nadu is not directly in the path of the low-pressure system, its coastal regions will still be affected.

title: Ambala News: साहा-मुलाना के गांवों में बाढ़ जैसे हालात, एनएच 344 पर फ्लाईओवर के नीचे जलभराव - Amar Ujala
article_text:
Ambala News: साहा-मुलाना के गांवों में बाढ़ जैसे हालात, एनएच 344 पर फ्लाईओवर के नीचे जलभराव
अमर उजाला ब्यूरो
Updated Wed, 20 Aug 2025 02:31 AM IST
साहा। साहा और मुलाना के छह गांवों में बेगना नदी के पानी ने मार की है। यह गांव नदी के समीप पड़ते हैं। यहां पर खेतों में फसलें डूबी हुई हैं, वहीं नदी का पानी खेतों से ओवरफ्लो होते हुए पंचकूला यमुनानगर राष्ट्रीय राजमार्ग नंबर 344 के फ्लाईओवर के नीचे अभी तक बह रहा है। हालांकि राजमार्ग पर फ्लाईओवर के के ऊपर से यातायात सुचारू है। साहा और मुलाना में बाढ़ जैसे हालात बने हुए हैं। नदी के पानी को निकलने का रास्ता भी नहीं मिल रहा है। यही कारण से कि गांव में पानी खेतों में भर गया है, वहीं अब ग्रामीणों काे डर सता रहा है कि कहीं पेयजल दूषित न हो जाए, इसके साथ ही साहा गांव की गलियों में भी जलभराव की स्थिति बनी हुई है। इसी प्रकार अंबाला से साहा को जाने वाले मार्ग पर भी सड़क के दोनों तरफ काफी जलभराव है, जिसमें फुटपाथ पूरी तरह से डूब गया है।

title: Heavy Rains Batter Kalyana Karnataka, Malnad Sees Relief - Deccan Herald
article_text:
Rains continued to batter Belagavi and several districts in Kalyana Karnataka region on Tuesday.
Copious rains have filled water bodies and rivers are in spate. Rainwater has gushed into low-lying areas and inundated farmlands. The Linganamakki dam in Shivamogga district is on the verge of reaching full reservoir level. Jog Falls has regained its glory owing to heavy rains in catchment areas.
Kalaburagi, Bidar, Yadgir, Raichur and Koppal district received heavy rains on the day. As much as two lakh cusec of water is being released into River Krishna from Basavarasagara dam in Narayanapur. As a result, Sheelahalli bridge in Lingsugur taluk of Raichur district is submerged, cutting off road connectivity to several villages in the vicinity.
However rains receded in Kodagu and Hassan districts. Since water level in River Cauvery has risen, the entry of tourists to Dubare elephant camp has been banned.

title: Mumbai Rain Live Updates: Heavy Rain Alert Today, Airlines Issue Travel Advisory - NDTV
article_text:
Mumbai Rains, Weather Today News LIVE Updates: The India Meteorological Department today issued a warning for heavy rain and thunderstorms for Mumbai and some other Maharashtra districts. The residents are advised to remain indoors and avoid going into low-lying or flood-prone areas.

A red warning has also been issued for Thane, Palghar, Raigad, and Ratnagiri districts.

Airlines have put out advisories for passengers, warning about delays and traffic issues due to waterlogging on several routes.

Due to heavy waterlogging in several regions multiple local train services have been cancelled for today.

As many as 782 passengers were rescued on Tuesday evening after two overcrowded Monorail trains on elevated tracks got stuck between stations in Mumbai on a day of torrential rains.

Some of the suburbs in Mumbai received more than 200 mm rainfall in the 21-hour period ending at 5.30 am on Wednesday, as per officials.

According to data released by the Maharashtra Disaster Management Department, six people have lost their lives in rain and flood-related issues in the last 24 hours in the state.

Meanwhile, authorities in Pune on Tuesday said a red alert will remain in place for the next two days in the Ghat areas as heavy rains continue to batter many parts of the city and the surrounding regions.

title: Mumbai Rains News Live Updates: IMD issues red alert for Mumbai; several local trains cancelled amid heav... - The Economic Times
article_text:
Mumbai Rain Live Updates: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) issued an red alert of heavy rains for Mumbai for August 20, reported TOI. The city's local train services faced widespread cancellations on Wednesday due to severe waterlogging across the city and several trains have been cancelled. Authorities have advised commuters to check schedules and plan travel in advance.

title: Mumbai rain mayhem: IMD issues ‘red alert’; local trains cancelled, Mumbai University exam postponed | 10 updates | Latest News India - Hindustan Times - Hindustan Times
article_text:
Subscribe Now! Get features like
The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a red alert of very heavy rain for Mumbai for Wednesday, August 20, a day after another spell of downpour battered the Maharashtra capital for the fifth consecutive, paralysing life with flooding, suspended trains, flight diversions and evacuation drives in low-lying areas.
As many as 782 passengers were rescued on Tuesday evening after two overcrowded Monorail trains on elevated tracks got stuck between stations in Mumbai, leading to panic and frantic rescue efforts. More than a dozen passengers complained of suffocation with a couple of them reportedly fainting as electricity and air-conditioning shut down, though only one passenger had to be hospitalised and her condition was said to be stable.
The Mithi River swelled dangerously close to the danger mark, while the IMD predicted that the intensity of rainfall in the metropolis would go down from Thursday.
Meanwhile, the University of Mumbai postponed all examinations scheduled for Wednesday.

title: Heavy Rains Batter Maharashtra: 21 Dead in Four Days, Red Alert Issued - Newsonair
article_text:
At least 21 people have died in the last four days due to rain and flood-related incidents across Maharashtra. The torrential rain continues in Mumbai, Thane, Palghar, Konkan and other parts of Maharashtra for the fourth consecutive day. Eight people have died in the Nanded district, which is severely affected by the flood. According to IMD, Mumbai has received a record rainfall of around 300 mm, disrupting normal life in the city.

The weather agency issued a red alert to the Vidharbha Region today. Given safety concerns, all the trains between Pune and Mumbai were suspended till further notice. Thane and Raigad districts declared a holiday for schools and colleges today. All primary schools in Patan, Jawli, Mahabaleshwar, Wai, Satara and Karad talukas will also remain closed today and tomorrow as the IMD issues an orange alert in the region. Around 350 people have been rescued and moved to safe locations after the Mithi river breached the danger mark.

The Modak Sagar Dam is currently 98 per cent full, and authorities have warned that heavy rainfall could lead to overflow today. Officials have advised that residents and villages along and near the Vaitarna River downstream remain alert and cautious. The six curved gates of the Koyna Dam have also been opened, releasing 93,200 cusecs of water into the Koyna riverbed. All concerned agencies have been instructed to take necessary preventive measures to ensure public safety in case of sudden water release from the dam.

title: Heavy rain likely to lash Odisha till Aug 24, yellow warning issued for several districts - Odisha TV
article_text:
The Regional Meteorological Centre predicts rainfall in southern and interior Odisha until August 24 due to a low-pressure system, with yellow warnings for heavy rain, thunderstorms, and lightning issued for multiple districts.
Heavy rain likely to lash Odisha till Aug 24, yellow warning issued for several districts
Under the influence of a low-pressure system, several parts of southern and interior Odisha are likely to witness rainfall till August 24, the Regional Meteorological Centre predicted on Wednesday.
A yellow warning for heavy rain accompanied by thunderstorms and lightning has been issued for 11 districts for today: Balasore, Bhadrak, Jajpur, Kendrapara, Cuttack, Jagatsinghpur, Puri, Khordha, Nayagarh, Keonjhar and Mayurbhanj.
The weather office has also issued a yellow warning for six districts tomorrow, cautioning of heavy to very heavy rainfall in some areas.
Authorities have advised residents of the affected districts to remain alert, avoid exposure during thunderstorms, and take necessary precautions.
Meanwhile, landslides, submergence of roads and bridges, and uprooting of trees were reported from the southern districts of Malkangiri, Koraput and Nabarangpur.
The IMD said the sea condition is very likely to be rough along the Andhra Pradesh, Odisha and West Bengal coast during the period, advising fishermen not to venture out.

title: Heavy Rain to Lash Odisha Till Aug 24, IMD Issues Yellow Warning - Pragativadi
article_text:
The Regional Meteorological Centre, Bhubaneswar, on Wednesday predicted widespread rainfall across southern and interior Odisha till August 24 under the influence of a low-pressure system.

A yellow warning for heavy rain, thunderstorms, and lightning has been issued for 11 districts today—Balasore, Bhadrak, Jajpur, Kendrapara, Cuttack, Jagatsinghpur, Puri, Khordha, Nayagarh, Keonjhar, and Mayurbhanj. For tomorrow, warnings remain in place for six districts, with forecasts of heavy to very heavy rain in isolated areas.

Authorities have urged residents in the affected districts to remain cautious, avoid exposure during thunderstorms, and take safety measures.

Meanwhile, landslides, road and bridge submergence, and uprooting of trees have been reported from Malkangiri, Koraput, and Nabarangpur districts, disrupting normal life.

The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has further cautioned that sea conditions are likely to remain rough along the Andhra Pradesh, Odisha, and West Bengal coasts. Fishermen have been strictly advised not to venture into the sea during this period.

title: Heavy rainfall predicted till 24th August, yellow alert issued for 11 Odisha districts today - Kalinga TV
article_text:
Heavy rainfall predicted till 24th August, yellow alert issued for 11 Odisha districts today
Due to the effect of the depression, rain is continuing in the interior Odisha.
By Himanshu Last updated Aug 20, 2025
 Share

Bhubaneswar: The depression is weakening. It will turn into a well-marked low-pressure area in the next 12 hours. It will gradually move west-northwestwards and head towards South Odisha and South Chhattisgarh.

Due to the effect of the depression, rain is continuing in the interior Odisha. Accordingly, the MeT Centre has predicted that heavy rain will continue till 24th August.

A yellow alert has been issued for 11 Odisha districts today for heavy rainfall. The alert has been issued for Balasore, Bhadrak, Jajpur, Kendrapara, Cuttack, Jagatsinghpur, Puri, Khordha, Nayagarh, Puri, Keonjhar and Mayurbhanj.

The Meteorological Centre has also issued a warning of thunderstorms in various districts till 24th August.

title: நடப்பாண்டில் 5-வது முறையாக நிரம்பிய மேட்டூர் அணை- வினாடிக்கு 90,500 கன அடி நீர் வெளியேற்றம்! Mettur Dam Fills Up for the 5th Time This Year – 90,500 cusecs of Water Released - minnambalam.com
article_text:
நடப்பாண்டில் 5-வது முறையாக நிரம்பிய மேட்டூர் அணை- வினாடிக்கு 90,500 கன அடி நீர் வெளியேற்றம்!

Published On: 20 Aug 2025, 7:08 AM

| By Mathi

காவிரியின் குறுக்கே கட்டப்பட்டுள்ள மேட்டூர் அணை நடப்பாண்டில் 5-வது முறையாக முழு கொள்ளளவான 120 அடியை எட்டியுள்ளது. மேட்டூர் அணையில் இருந்து தற்போது வினாடிக்கு 90,500 கன அடிநீர் வெளியேற்றப்பட்டு வருகிறது. இதனால் காவிரி கரையோர மாவட்டங்களுக்கு வெள்ள அபாய எச்சரிக்கை விடுக்கப்பட்டுள்ளது.

தென்மேற்கு பருவமழை கொட்டித் தீர்க்கிறது. கேரளா, கர்நாடகாவில் காவிரி மற்றும் அதன் துணை ஆறுகளின் நீர் பிடிப்பு பகுதிகளில் இடைவிடாது கனமழை பெய்து வருகிறது.

ADVERTISEMENT

இதனால் காவிரி, காவிரியின் துணை நதியான கபினி ஆறு ஆகியவற்றில் வெள்ளம் கரைபுரண்டோடுகிறது. கர்நாடகாவில் காவிரியின் குறுக்கே கட்டப்பட்டுள்ள கிருஷ்ணராஜ சாகர் அணை, கபினியின் குறுக்கே கட்டப்பட்டுள்ள கபினி அணைகள் நிரம்பியதால் அணைகளுக்கு வரும் நீர் அப்படியே தமிழகத்துக்கு திறந்துவிடப்படுகிறது.

தமிழ்நாட்டின் எல்லையான பிலிகுண்டுலுவை தாண்டி ஒகேனக்கலுக்கு காவிரி நீரின் வரத்து வினாடிக்கு 1,05,000 கன அடியாக உள்ளது. இதனால் மேட்டூர் அணை நடப்பாண்டில் 5-வது முறையாக முழு கொள்ளளவான 120 அடியை எட்டிவிட்டது. மேட்டூர் அணையில் இருந்து வினாடிக்கு 90,500 கன அடிநீர் வெளியேற்றப்பட்டு வருகிறது.

ADVERTISEMENT

மேட்டூர் அணையில் இருந்து 16 கண் மதகுகள் வழியாக பெருமளவு தண்ணீர் திறந்துவிடப்படுவதால் காவிரி ஆற்றின் கரையோரத்தில் உள்ள 11 மாவட்டங்களுக்கு வெள்ள அபாய எச்சரிக்கை விடுக்கப்பட்டுள்ளது.

title: ভারী বৃষ্টির পূর্বাভাস, ১০ জেলায় বন্যার শঙ্কা - daily-sun.com
article_text:
দেশের অভ্যন্তরে সিলেট, চট্টগ্রাম, ময়মনসিংহ ও রংপুর বিভাগে এবং উজানে ভারতের হিমালয় পাদদেশীয় পশ্চিমবঙ্গ, মেঘালয়, আসাম ও ত্রিপুরা প্রদেশে ২০ আগস্ট (বুধবার) থেকে আগামী ২৪ আগস্ট (রবিবার) পর্যন্ত ভারি বৃষ্টির সম্ভাবনা রয়েছে।

এ সময় স্থানভেদে ২০০ থেকে ২৫০ মিলিমিটার বৃষ্টি হতে পারে। এতে নদ-নদীর পানি বেড়ে দেশের উত্তর, উত্তর-পূর্ব ও দক্ষিণ-পূর্বাঞ্চলের ১০ জেলার নিম্নাঞ্চল সাময়িকভাবে প্লাবিত হতে পারে।

মঙ্গলবার (১৯ আগস্ট) রাতে বাংলাদেশ পানি উন্নয়ন বোর্ডের (পাউবো) বন্যা পূর্বাভাস ও সতর্কীকরণ কেন্দ্র এক বিশেষ বার্তায় এ আশঙ্কার কথা জানিয়েছে।

বন্যা পূর্বাভাস ও সতর্কীকরণ কেন্দ্র জানিয়েছে, ২০ থেকে ২২ আগস্ট পর্যন্ত উত্তরাঞ্চলের তিস্তা নদীর পানি বেড়ে নীলফামারী ও লালমনিরহাট জেলায় সতর্কসীমায় প্রবাহিত হতে পারে। এতে দুই জেলার নদীসংলগ্ন নিম্নাঞ্চল সাময়িকভাবে প্লাবিত হতে পারে।

title: Gujarat rain forecast : ગુજરાતમાં આજથી ત્રણ દિવસ ભારેથી અતિ ભારે વરસાદની આગાહી, આ વિસ્તારોમાં વરસાદનું રેડ એલર્ટ જાહેર - Indian Express - Gujarati
article_text:
Aaj Nu Havaman, Gujarat weather Rain Forecast Update: ગુજરાતમાં વરસાદની માહોલ વચ્ચે મેઘાની ધમાકેદાર બેટિંગ થઈ રહી છે. દક્ષિણ ગુજરાત અને સૌરાષ્ટ્રના વિસ્તારોમાં ભારે વરસાદ પડી રહ્યો છે. કેટલાક વિસ્તારોમાં જળબંબાકારની સ્થિતિ સરજાઈ હતી. આવી સ્થિતિ વચ્ચે હવામાન વિભાગે દક્ષિણ ગુજરાત અને સૌરાષ્ટ્રના જિલ્લાઓમાં ત્રણ દિવસ વરસાદનું રેડ એલર્ટ આપ્યું છે.
હવામાન વિભાગમાં આજે 20 ઓગસ્ટથી ત્રણ દિવસ માટે દક્ષિણ ગુજરાત અને સૌરાષ્ટ્રના જિલ્લાઓમાં વરસાદનું રેડ એલર્ટ આપ્યું છે. હવામાન વિભાગ પ્રમાણે નવસારી, વલસાડ, દમણ, દાદરા નગર હવેલી, દ્વારકા, પોરબંદર, જૂનાગઢ, ગીર સોમનાથ અને દીવમાં ભારેથી અતિ ભારે વરસાદની આગાહી કરી છે.
હવામાન વિભાગ પ્રમાણે આજે બુધવારના દિવસે ભરૂચ, સુરત, ડાંગ, તાપી, રાજકોટ, જામનગર, અમરેલી, ભાવનગર અને કચ્છમાં અતિ ભારે વરસાદ પડવાની શક્યતા છે. આ વિસ્તારોમાં વરસાદનું ઓરેન્જ એલર્ટ આપ્યું છે.
આ પણ વાંચોઃ- Navratri 2025: આ વર્ષે અમદાવાદમાં પણ યોજાશે “માવડીનાં ગરબા”, જાણો તમામ માહિતી
હવામાન વિભાગે આજે બનાસકાંઠા, પાટણ, મહેસાણા, સાબરકાંઠા, ગાંધીનગર, અરવલ્લી, ખેડા, અમદાવાદ, આણંદ, પંચમહાલ, દાહોદ, મહિસાગર, વડોદરા, છોટા ઉદેપુર, નર્મદા, સુરેન્દ્રનગર, મોરબી અને બોટાદમાં યલો એલર્ટ જાહેર કર્યું છે. આ વિસ્તારોમાં ભારે વરસાદની આગાહી કરી છે.

title: Rains continue in Uttarakhand, Water levels of major rivers rising - The Right News
article_text:
Home/Feature Stories/Rains continue in Uttarakhand, Water levels of major rivers rising
Feature StoriesNationalTrending Photo
Rains continue in Uttarakhand, Water levels of major rivers rising
2 weeks ago
0 3 Less than a minute

In Uttarakhand, due to ongoing rainfall since last evening in various parts of the state, the water levels of major rivers have risen, while mountain streams are in full spate. The Met Department has issued an orange alert for heavy to very heavy rainfall in Nainital, Champawat, and Bageshwar districts today.

A yellow alert has also been declared for the rest of the state, indicating the possibility of heavy rain. Meanwhile, in view of continuous rainfall in the Rudraprayag district, the Kedarnath Yatra has been temporarily suspended for safety reasons.

Pilgrims are currently being held at Sonprayag. The yatra will resume once weather conditions improve, and pilgrims will be allowed to proceed. In light of the heavy rain warning, a one-day holiday has been declared today for schools and Anganwadi centres in Dehradun, Nainital, and Champawat districts.
